title: Ben Stiller and wife Christine beam alongside their daughter at Project ALS benefit
text:
After losing a friend to ALS (Lou Gehrig's disease), Ben Stiller has been a prominent supporter of related charities.

Over 20 years after hosting Project ALS' kickoff event, the star was in attendance on Wednesday for the charity's Tomorrow is Tonight.

He was joined his daughter and his estranged wife for the 21st anniversary event in NYC.

Family event: Ben Stiller was in attendance on Wednesday for the charity's Tomorrow is Tonight and was joined his daughter and his estranged wife for the event in NYC

The Zoolander star, 53, was classic in a black suit, with one button closed.

He paired it with a grey collard shirt, black satin tie and dress shoes.

Though he separated from his wife Christine Taylor back in 2017, the two have been going on more and more public outings, possibly hinting at a reconciliation.

The 48-year-old actress wore a plunging black dress, with 3/4 sleeves and a frilled hem.

Reconcile: Though he separated from his wife Christine Taylor back in 2017, the two have been going on more and more public outings, possibly hinting at a reconciliation

Her dress was covered in a busy purple floral pattern and she paired it with nude pointed toe pumps.

Accompanying them was their daughter Ella Olivia, 17, who was a bright splash of color in a green polka dot wrap dress.

The teenager paired it with gold stilettos and a layered silver necklace.

Also: Ben posed with Richard Kind

Excited: Ben's daughter Ella seemed excited to see Judy Gold

Variety reported back in 2008 that ten years prior a close friend, Jenifer Estess, was diagnosed with ALS, and died in 2004.

Her sister's, Valerie and Meredith, founded Project ALS in 1998 to increase awareness for the disease.

Along with the famed comedian Julianna Margulies and Richard Kind were on hand for the anniversary event.

Stunner: Julianna Margulies stunned in a textured, black one-shoulder cocktail dress

Glam: Her hair was styled perfectly in curls

The Good Wife actress stunned in a textured, black one-shoulder cocktail dress.

She posed before the event with charity founder Valeries Estess and her husband Keith Lieberthal.

The anniversary event sold tickets from $1,000 to premium tables for $50,000, while honoring families affected by ALS.

Date night: She posed before the event with her husband Keith Lieberthal
